summary: This guide provides you to enable ambient occlusion in Skyrim without using ENB. Mostly suggested for AMD users.
descriptionHtml:
[center]MannyGT's Skyrim Mods

presents

[size=5]Ambient Occlusion for AMD users[/size][/center]

A tiny guide to enable Ambient Occlusion in Skyrim without using ENB tool. This guide is for AMD users like me but it works for nVidia as well too.
However the nVidia users already have a tool to enable Ambient Occlusion and is called "nVidia Inspector".
Since I don't have nVidia videocard, I find GeDoSaTo tool made by Durante.

[center] [img]http://i.imgur.com/rE9J1gg.jpg[/img]
GeDoSaTo by Durante
[/center]

The main feature of this tool is to downsample high resolutions but it have the Ambient Occlusion feature too. Here an example:

[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/5iyg9pt.jpg[/img]

[img]http://i.imgur.com/4hyAHAW.jpg[/img][/center]

My rig PC is:

- CPU: AMD FX-6300 @3.5GHz - Turbo @4.3GHz
- RAM: 8GB DDR3
- VIDEO: AMD R9 270X Sapphire Dual-X OC

I have 0 fps loos or near-0. No more. So download the PDF and follow the instructions. Is pretty simple to do.


* CREDITS *
GeDoSaTo tool is made by Durante

http://blog.metaclassofnil.com


* THIS GUIDE IS PROVIDED "AS IS" *
I've no responsibility for loosing and/or damaged data on your PC. This extends to Durante too. I give him just credits and links for making this guide.


* LIKE ME ON FACEBOOK *
https://www.facebook.com/MannyGTSkyrimMods
author: MannyGT
